treatment.reference: Methanocorpusculaceae fam. nov., represented by Methanocorpusculum parvum, Methanocorpusculum sinense spec. nov. and Methanocorpusculum bavaricum spec. nov. Arch Microbiol 151:381-390
treatment.description: Small, irregular coccoid cells usually occurring singly, < 1 µm in diameter. Flagellated and weakly motile. Gram negative. Cell envelope consists of a hexagonally arranged S-layer with a center-to-center spacing of the subunits of 15.8 nm. Glycoprotein subunits with an apparent molecular weight of Mr 92000 are found. Obligately anaerobic and chemoorganotrophic. Methane is produced from H2/CO2 and formate. No growth or methane production from acetate, methylamines, methanol, ethanol, l-propanol, 2-propanol/CO2, 1-butanol, 2-butanol/CO2 and cyclohexanol. The optimal growth temperature is 30˚C. No growth observed at or below 15˚C and at or above 45˚C. Optimal pH 7.0. No dependence of growth on NaCl. Growth factors present in clarified rumen fluid are required for growth. G+C content of the DNA is 52.0 mo1% (Tm) and 50.0 mol% (HPLC).
